# How to reset Cozmo to factory firmware {#how-to-reset-cozmo-to-factory-firmware .title}

[](javascript:window.print() "Print this article"){.printArticle
aria-label="Print this Article"}

If a DDL Brand Ambassador asks you to reset Cozmo to factory firmware or
to firmware-cycle Cozmo, please follow the steps below. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------

::: sections
# My Cozmo has a backpack button

1.  Cozmo should not be connected to the app
2.  Place Cozmo on his charging platform (plugged into a power source)
3.  Press and hold his backpack button and raise his lift 3 times at the
    same time
4.  Leave Cozmo on his charging platform until his screen and backpack
    light go off
5.  Take Cozmo off his charging platform (his light remains off when in
    this state) and then put him back on the charging platform
6.  Connect to Cozmo on the latest app version to update his firmware to
    the latest version
7.  You have now performed a \"firmware-cycle\"
:::

::: sections
![](//d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/5e3f0b1e2c7d3a7e9ae777f5/images/5e7d768d04286364bc975b6b/img-2828-1585280652-1516753417.gif)

# My Cozmo does not have a backpack button

1.  Disconnect your device from Cozmo's WiFi network
2.  Place Cozmo on his charging platform (plugged into a power source)
3.  Raise and lower Cozmo's Lift so that his WiFi Network Name (SSID)
    and Password (PSK) appear on his screen
4.  Move Cozmo's head down and up once to display the detailed info
    screen (be careful to not move the lift because that will turn off
    the screen and you'll have to start all over again)
5.  Move Cozmo's head down and up a second time to display the hidden
    menu
6.  Using the track on the right (Cozmo's left side), roll it backwards
    until the '\>' points to Factory Reset
7.  Raise and lower his lift to select Factory Reset
8.  Take Cozmo off his charging platform (his light will be off when in
    this state) and then put him back on the charging platform
9.  Connect to Cozmo on the latest app version to update his firmware to
    the latest version
10. You have now performed a \"firmware-cycle\"

![](//d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/5e3f0b1e2c7d3a7e9ae777f5/images/5e7d768d2c7d3a7e9ae9e281/img-2828-1585280652-1474788869.gif)

![](//d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/5e3f0b1e2c7d3a7e9ae777f5/images/5e7d768e04286364bc975b6c/img-2828-1585280652-188997440.gif)![](//d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/5e3f0b1e2c7d3a7e9ae777f5/images/5e7d768e2c7d3a7e9ae9e282/img-2828-1585280653-2061525031.gif)

![](//d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/5e3f0b1e2c7d3a7e9ae777f5/images/5e7d768e04286364bc975b6d/img-2828-1585280653-298804408.gif)
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

::: sections
# Some notes about resetting Cozmo to factory firmware

-   You cannot play with Cozmo when he is in factory firmware. You must
    upgrade it by connecting to him in the latest version of the app
-   After you perform the reset and before connecting to Cozmo, it is
    normal that his light goes off if you remove him from the charging
    platform
-   Gameplay progress stored in Cozmo is not lost by resetting Cozmo
-   To erase any gameplay progress in Cozmo, please see [this
    FAQ](//support.digitaldreamlabs.com/article/240-how-to-erase-or-restore-cozmo){target="_blank"}
-   A reset may help resolve transitory software issues
-   It will not resolve any hardware issues
-   A reset does not change Cozmo's WiFi Network Name (SSID) or Password
    (PSK)

 
:::
